citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
IACUC minutes and records indicate semiannual evaluations of the animal care program and facilities were completed on
September 15, 2022 and February 16, 2023 but no reports of these evaluations for submission to the Institutional Official
were written.
Properly completed semiannual evaluations and reports, including submission of reports to the Institutional Official, are an
essential function of the IACUC in it's mandate to assess the animal program, facilities and procedures and ensure the
humane care and use of animals.
The IACUC remains responsible for the evaluations and reports as required by the Act and regulations. The reports shall
be reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members, shall be updated at least once every six months upon
completion of the required semiannual evaluations, and shall be maintained by the research facility and made available to
APHIS upon request.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(3)  Repeat
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
IACUC minutes and records indicate semiannual evaluations of the animal care program and facilities were completed on 
September 15, 2022 and February 16, 2023 but no reports of these evaluations for submission to the Institutional Official 
were written. 
Properly completed semiannual evaluations and reports, including submission of reports to the Institutional Official, are an 
essential function of the IACUC in it's mandate to assess the animal program, facilities and procedures and ensure the 
humane care and use of animals. 
The IACUC remains responsible for the evaluations and reports as required by the Act and regulations. The reports shall 
be reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members, shall be updated at least once every six months upon 
completion of the required semiannual evaluations, and shall be maintained by the research facility and made available to 
APHIS upon request. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
